chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica L Adamski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Successfully complete "Batterers intervention for Victims" counseling. Complete a parenting class. Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate. Cooperate with all MBCW and Children's Court orders.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens. Maintain absolute sobriety.

No contact with Devale Randle UNLESS the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact. Devale Randle to have no contact with the children unless approved by Children's Court. Court advised defendant of penalties for violationg the no contact order.

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Obtain and maintain employment or attend school.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on 10-24-14.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica L Adamski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Transcript commencing 01/08/2015 SENTENCE HEARING received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF4021 (71 Pages).

Defendant Jessica L Adamski in court with attorney Scott P. Phillips.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Jessica L Adamski in court with attorney Scott P Phillips.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 17 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 10/24/14.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention for Victims" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Cooperate with all MBCW and Children's Court orders.
-No contact with Devale Randle UNLESS the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Devale Randle to have no contact with the children unless approved by Children's Court.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment or attend school.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
At the request of the defense, Court removed Justice Point supervision as a condition of bail.
Court modified the no contact order to allow for contact as supervised by the MBCW.

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.

Defendant Jessica L Adamski in court with attorney Scott P Phillips.  Cynthia Davis for Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Misdemeanor Child Neglect, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.21(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-22-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jessica L Adamski in court with attorney Scott P Phillips.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
Clerk:  jms
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Same conditions to apply.  Court ordered the defendant to cooperate with any Children's Court orders and attend all future court dates.
Court grants the joint request for modification of bail.

On motion of the State, Court ordered case transferred to Judge Rebecca Dallet, Branch 40.  Clerk contacted clerk and this case will be accepted by Branch 40.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 40.

Defendant Jessica L Adamski in court with attorney Scott P. Phillips.  Defendant Jessica L Adamski in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Matt Torbenson.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.   
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with D.R. (12-13-2013).  
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jessica L Adamski in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle. Defendant Jessica L Adamski is in custody. Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
